section.name: JGGApi - Gadu-Gadu protocol implementation.
section.p: JGGApi is a Gadu-Gadu protocol implementation based on specification from EKG. Thanks to it is very easy to create applications that communicate with Gadu-Gadu server. It uses commonly used design patterns (GoF) that minimizie the learnining curve for developers.

section.name: Released
section.p: There is an old version of the library that has already been released. It works fine but has limited functionality.

Currently we are preparing for the new release of the library (1.) that has many improvements and clearer design. It is not compatible with the old version, interfaces have changed significantly but porting from old version should not be a difficult task.

section.name: Features
section.p:
The new version of the library (1.0) will allow:
1. Sending and receiving messages.
2. Exporting and importing of the contact list.
3. Setting status and notification of user's changing status.
4. Notification of changing statuses.
5. Ability to read and write personal information to the public directory.
6. Possibility to search public directory based on user defined criteria.
